Package org.radarbase.oauth

Class OAuth2AccessTokenDetails

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.radarbase.oauth.OAuth2AccessTokenDetails
  • public class OAuth2AccessTokenDetails
extends java.lang.Object
    This class captures the response from ManagementPortal's /oauth/token endpoint. The actual access token can be retrieved with the getAccessToken() method. This is a token in JWT format, and can be parsed with a JWT library of your preference. You can use isValid() to check if you got a valid token, or an error response. If isValid() returns false, you can use getError() and getErrorDescription() to find the error message that was returned by ManagementPortal. You can also use isExpired() to find out if the token has expired or not. However it is advised to use the OAuth2Client class, as it will automatically manage token refreshing and checking validity.

      • getErrorDescription

        public java.lang.String getErrorDescription()
        Get the error description.

        Some errors cause an error description to be populated in the error_description field, other cause the message field to be populated. This method first checks for the error_description field, and returns it if not null. Otherwise it checks the message field and returns that if not null. If both fields are null this method returns an empty string.

        Returns:
        the error description

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired()

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Check the validity of this token.
        Returns:
        true if the accessToken field is not null and the error field is null

        Parse an access token response into an OAuth2AccessTokenDetails object.
        Parameters:
        responseBody - the response body
        Returns:
        an instance of this class
        Throws:
        TokenException - if the response can not be parsed to an instance of this class
